pr_title: Revert commit for new implementation of omitting JSON fields

timeline.bodyText: this doesn't check to see if it's the first field... if host and type are omitted, this would cause problem
timeline.author: donbourne

timeline.bodyText: this code doesn't check to see if host, userdir, or servername are supposed to be omitted
timeline.author: donbourne

timeline.bodyText: this is a fair bit more expensive perf-wise than just adding a single field.  need to not have to recompose this on every event.
timeline.author: donbourne

timeline.bodyText: was this comment change and change below intentional?  perhaps something related to the revert?
timeline.author: donbourne
donbourne

timeline.bodyText: with change above (on lines 512-514) pair will never end with ":"
timeline.author: donbourne

timeline.bodyText: OR if messageFormat -> OR if consoleFormat
timeline.author: donbourne

replies.bodyText: This should have been messageFormat in the first commit instead of consoleFormat
replies.author: ellen-lau

timeline.bodyText: this would make logging requests received during the update use the json field name defaults rather than their values from before the update happened.  Aliases need to go from their pre-update value to their post-update value without momentarily being set to their original value.
timeline.author: donbourne

timeline.bodyText: isInvalidEventType might be better name for this one
timeline.author: donbourne

timeline.bodyText: need to do the null check first to avoid potential NPEs on the isEmpty check
timeline.author: donbourne

timeline.bodyText: this should also reset the extensions
timeline.author: donbourne

timeline.bodyText:
need to also clear originalExtensions.
Please also add test cases for clearing/setting ext_ aliases to the json logging bucket - seems like this may be lacking
timeline.author: donbourne

timeline.bodyText: add test to rename ext_testExtension to another value before omitting it.
timeline.author: donbourne

timeline.bodyText: should make a call to the server to remove the registered extension to clean up
timeline.author: donbourne

timeline.bodyText: should also check to make sure MY_EXTENSION doesn't appear in the log here (in case the reconfiguration doesn't happen properly)
timeline.author: donbourne

timeline.bodyText: I think here you would want to watch for "RENAME" again since that's the last thing the test configured the field to be named.
timeline.author: donbourne

timeline.bodyText: the regex we tested was ^.*module:((?!ibm_sequence).)*$ -- I understand why you have added the quotes around module and put loglevel in instead of ibm_sequence, but I think it should be $ at the end rather than ?
timeline.author: donbourne

timeline.message: Revert commit for new implementation of omitting JSON fields

New Implementation Commit

Simplifying applyJsonFields and and re-adding previous fix from other issue

returning length check to original code

Making null check first and only resetting aliases when jsonFieldMappings is empty

Reset ext fields in resetAliases

New Implementation Commit

Adding test case for renaming and omitting extension fields

Add to test case, fixed message format clause, regate beta

Adding extra checks to FAT

Ensure logs are created

Adding test case for renaming and omitting extension fields

Fixing NullPointerException

Moving applyJsonFields to the end of update

Fixing NPE caused by jsonFieldMappings formatting error in bootstrap/env

Correcting test case servers and making test cases more specific

Fixing error messages for test cases

Fix ending character regex

Fixing test case servers and modifying regex to be more specific

Correcting test case servers and making test cases more specific

Fixing error messages for test cases

Fix ending character regex

Fixing test case servers and modifying regex to be more specific

Correcting test case servers and making test cases more specific

timeline.bodyText: jsonBuilder
timeline.author: donbourne
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,217 @@
+/*******************************************************************************

+ * are made available under the terms of the Eclipse Public License v1.0
+ * which accompanies this distribution, and is available at

+ *     IBM Corporation - initial API and implementation
+ *******************************************************************************/
+package com.ibm.ws.logging.data;
+
+/* Class for JSON formatting of key-value pairs for logging
+ *
+ *
+ */
+
+public class JSONObject {
+    private boolean hasAnyFields = false;
+    private final String OMIT_FIELDS_STRING = "@@@OMIT@@@";
+    private final StringBuilder JSONBuilder = new StringBuilder();

timeline.bodyText: startLogEntry shouldn't be specified by the caller.  To start, a caller should either add a field (implying JSONObject needs to start the log entry) or should add raw JSON.
timeline.author: donbourne
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,217 @@
+/*******************************************************************************
+ * Copyright (c) 2020 IBM Corporation and others.
+ * All rights reserved. This program and the accompanying materials
+ * are made available under the terms of the Eclipse Public License v1.0
+ * which accompanies this distribution, and is available at
+ * http://www.eclipse.org/legal/epl-v10.html
+ *
+ * Contributors:
+ *     IBM Corporation - initial API and implementation
+ *******************************************************************************/
+package com.ibm.ws.logging.data;
+
+/* Class for JSON formatting of key-value pairs for logging
+ *
+ *
+ */
+
+public class JSONObject {
+    private boolean hasAnyFields = false;
+    private final String OMIT_FIELDS_STRING = "@@@OMIT@@@";
+    private final StringBuilder JSONBuilder = new StringBuilder();
+
+    public JSONObject(boolean startLogEntry) {
+        if (startLogEntry)
+            JSONBuilder.append("{");
+    }

timeline.bodyText: looks like trim isn't used -- if it's not needed, should remove it
timeline.author: donbourne

timeline.bodyText: should combine all of the addField methods into one that does most of the work, and all the others just pass along the String representation of the value and an indicator of whether quotes are needed around the value.
timeline.author: donbourne

timeline.bodyText: rather than a "closeLog" method, I think this whole class would work a bit better if you follow builder pattern... https://dzone.com/articles/design-patterns-the-builder-pattern.  That would mean you'd make this a build method that would close out the bracket and return a JSON instance.  This class would become a Builder class.
timeline.author: donbourne
